meanings.definition: The condition or quality of being radiant.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with the beautiful irradiances of the morning sun.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the irradiances of happiness in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The irradiances of joy on her face were contagious to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with the irradiances of hope and inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a place of peace and tranquility, bathed in the irradiances of nature.

meanings.definition: The amount of radiant energy emitted or received per unit area.
meanings.sent1: The solar panels were designed to capture the irradiances of sunlight efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measured the irradiances of heat emitted by the volcano.
meanings.sent3: The irradiances of energy from the stars seemed to twinkle in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The field was blanketed in the irradiances of warmth from the sun.
meanings.sent5: The plants thrived in the irradiances of light streaming through the greenhouse windows.
